title: Official Trailer for 'Stealing Pulp Fiction' Movie Geeks Indie Comedy
description: "Low risk, high reward!" Or so they thought... But nope. Tribeca Films has revealed the official trailer for an indie comedy titled Stealing Pulp Fiction, marking the feature directorial debut of filmmaker Danny Turkiewicz. Another one of these meta films about film geeks trying to get involved in cinema by stealing something from another famous filmmaker – because why not. Much like Fanboys before this, and some of Kevin Smith's movies, too. This indie first premiered at the 2024 Newport Beach Film Festival last year, and will be out on VOD to watch this June. The film follows a group of enterprising wannabes and their eccentric therapist as they concoct a plot to steal Quentin Tarantino’s personal 35mm print of his famous 1994 film Pulp Fiction from his movie theater, quickly spirals into a chaotic misadventure with unexpected twists & mishaps. Starring Jon Rudnitsky, Karan Soni, Cazzie David, Jason Alexander, Taylor Hill, Oliver Cooper. Looks like everyone was having a blast making this! With New Beverly references galore, of course. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Danny Turkiewicz's film Stealing Pulp Fiction, from YouTube: Stealing Pulp Fiction follows a group of enterprising wannabes & their eccentric therapist as they […]
author: Alex Billington

text: TRAILERS by May 30, 2025Source: YouTube "Low risk, high reward!" Or so they thought... But nope. Tribeca Films has revealed the official trailer for an indie comedy titled Stealing Pulp Fiction, marking the feature directorial debut of filmmaker Danny Turkiewicz. Another one of these meta films about film geeks trying to get involved in cinema by stealing something from another famous filmmaker – because why not. Much like Fanboys before this, and some of Kevin Smith's movies, too. This indie first premiered at the 2024 Newport Beach Film Festival last year, and will be out on VOD to watch this June. The film follows a group of enterprising wannabes and their eccentric therapist as they concoct a plot to steal Quentin Tarantino’s personal 35mm print of his famous 1994 film Pulp Fiction from his movie theater, quickly spirals into a chaotic misadventure with unexpected twists & mishaps. Starring Jon Rudnitsky, Karan Soni, Cazzie David, Jason Alexander, Taylor Hill, Oliver Cooper. Looks like everyone was having a blast making this! With New Beverly references galore, of course. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Danny Turkiewicz's film Stealing Pulp Fiction, from YouTube: Stealing Pulp Fiction follows a group of enterprising wannabes & their eccentric therapist as they concoct a plot to steal Quentin Tarantino’s personal 35mm print of his famous 1994 film from his movie theater. What begins as a simple heist quickly spirals into a chaotic misadventure filled with unexpected twists and mishaps. Stealing Pulp Fiction is written and directed by American indie filmmaker Danny Turkiewicz, making his feature directorial debut with this project after many other short films previously. Produced by Chris Barry, Ben Shields Catlin, Ian Novotny, Dr. Slava Shut, Becca Standt, Jordan Willcox, Josh Zakaria, and Danny Turkiewicz. This initially premiered at the 2024 Newport Beach Film Festival last year. Tribeca Films releases Turkiewicz's Stealing Pulp Fiction comedy film in select US theaters + on VOD starting June 27th, 2025 coming up this summer. For more info + links, visit the film's official site. Any good? Who's in? Find more posts in: Indies, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
May 30, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Low risk, high reward!" Or so they thought... But nope. Tribeca Films has revealed the official trailer for an indie comedy titled Stealing Pulp Fiction, marking the feature directorial debut of filmmaker Danny Turkiewicz. Another one of these meta films about film geeks trying to get involved in cinema by stealing something from another famous filmmaker – because why not. Much like Fanboys before this, and some of Kevin Smith's movies, too. This indie first premiered at the 2024 Newport Beach Film Festival last year, and will be out on VOD to watch this June. The film follows a group of enterprising wannabes and their eccentric therapist as they concoct a plot to steal Quentin Tarantino’s personal 35mm print of his famous 1994 film Pulp Fiction from his movie theater, quickly spirals into a chaotic misadventure with unexpected twists & mishaps. Starring Jon Rudnitsky, Karan Soni, Cazzie David, Jason Alexander, Taylor Hill, Oliver Cooper. Looks like everyone was having a blast making this! With New Beverly references galore, of course.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Danny Turkiewicz's film Stealing Pulp Fiction, from YouTube:

Stealing Pulp Fiction follows a group of enterprising wannabes & their eccentric therapist as they concoct a plot to steal Quentin Tarantino’s personal 35mm print of his famous 1994 film from his movie theater. What begins as a simple heist quickly spirals into a chaotic misadventure filled with unexpected twists and mishaps. Stealing Pulp Fiction is written and directed by American indie filmmaker Danny Turkiewicz, making his feature directorial debut with this project after many other short films previously. Produced by Chris Barry, Ben Shields Catlin, Ian Novotny, Dr. Slava Shut, Becca Standt, Jordan Willcox, Josh Zakaria, and Danny Turkiewicz. This initially premiered at the 2024 Newport Beach Film Festival last year. Tribeca Films releases Turkiewicz's Stealing Pulp Fiction comedy film in select US theaters + on VOD starting June 27th, 2025 coming up this summer. For more info + links, visit the film's official site. Any good? Who's in?

Find more posts in: Indies, To Watch, Trailer
